The name of the playlist to add to
Seeks the MPD playback to some position in time.
Seeks the MPD playback to some position in time.
The `-Value` parameter has the form: - `N` where N is a `double`: treated as seconds
- `mm:ss` where `mm` is an integer and `ss` is a non-negative integer with an optional fractional part; `ss` must be below 60
- `hh:mm:ss` where `hh` is an integer, `mm` is an integer from 0 to 59 and `ss` is a non-negative integer with an optional fractional part; `ss` and `mm` must be below 60
If the string is prefixed with a minus sign (`-`) or a plus sign (`+`), the time to seek is relative to the current position. Otherwise, the cmdlet will seek to the exact time.
As a special case, you can provide a `System.TimeSpan` object to the `-Value` parameter; it will skip to the exact time (not relative).
Seek to a relative or absolute position; can be in mm:ss format and prefixed with + or -
Seek to a relative or absolute position; can be in mm:ss format and prefixed with + or -

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Seek forward 10 seconds Seek-Playback +10 # Seek backward 10 seconds Seek-Playback -10 # Seek to 01:35 (1 minute 35 seconds) Seek-Playback 01:35

maml:description.maml:para: Advances the playback to a song in the current MPD queue.
Advances the playback to a song in the current MPD queue.
Filters Tracks coming from the pipeline based on the title, album and artist.
Filters Tracks coming from the pipeline based on the title, album and artist.
Set the mixramp threshold in decibels
Set single state. When single is activated, playback is stopped after current song, or the song is repeated if the 'repeat' mode is enabled
Set the mixramp threshold in decibels
Set single state. When single is activated, playback is stopped after current song, or the song is repeated if the 'repeat' mode is enabled
Sets attributes of specified MPD outputs.
Sets attributes of specified MPD outputs.
Exact name of the output (case sensitive, no wildcards)
Exact name of the output (case sensitive, no wildcards)
Adjusts the playback volume of the most-recently connected MPD server.
Adjusts the playback volume of the most-recently connected MPD server.
- If the value starts with a `-`, the volume is decreased by that amount.
- If the value starts with a `+`, the volume is increased by that amount.
- Else, the volume is set to the amount.
Volume amount to adjust: -N, +N or N where N is a number
Volume amount to adjust: -N, +N or N where N is a number

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Set volume to 20% Set-MPDVolume 20 # Increase the volume by 10% Set-MPDVolume +10 # Decrease the volume by 10% Set-MPDVolume -10

maml:description.maml:para: Starts playback from the most-recently connected MPD server.
Starts playback from the most-recently connected MPD server.
Stops playback from the most-recently connected MPD server.
Stops playback from the most-recently connected MPD server.
Whereas `Pause-Playback` keeps the current position, `Stop-Playback` causes MPD to stop and move to the start of the currently playing song.
Exact name of the output (case sensitive, no wildcards)
Exact name of the output (case sensitive, no wildcards)
Synchronizes the current session with the MPD server.
Synchronizes the current session with the MPD server.

You need to call this cmdlet for most commands from this module to work correctly; e.g. to get tracks, albums or artists from the music database. You also need to call this cmdlet with the `-PlaylistsDir` option to let the module know about your local `.m3u` playlists.
Due to the limitations of the MPD protocol and the aims of PS-MPD, the playlists configured via `playlist_directory` in your MPD configuration file are ignored.
Synchronize state in the background. Note that any error or warning encountered will be lost.
The password to use while connecting to the MPD server
The port number of the MPD server
Path to the directory containing your m3u playlists
Synchronize state in the background. Note that any error or warning encountered will be lost.
The password to use while connecting to the MPD server
The port number of the MPD server
Path to the directory containing your m3u playlists
Toggles between playing and paused states of the most-recently connected MPD server.
Toggles between playing and paused states of the most-recently connected MPD server.
